intro: Parameria densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered parameria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Parameria densiflora is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
